definitions.definition: in sports, a player who is used for part of a game instead of another:
examples: One of the players was injured during the match, so a sub was brought on.

definitions.definition: a teacher who replaces teachers who are absent from work:
examples: A trained teacher, he found work as a sub which fit around his other commitments.

definitions.definition: in sports, to play in a match in someone's place:
examples: Travis subbed for the injured defender.

definitions.definition: to do a job temporarily when someone else cannot do it:
examples: As a young player, he subbed for Duke Ellington's drummer.

definitions.definition: to replace one player with another during a game:
examples: He was subbed in the match against Newcastle.

definitions.definition: less than a number or level:
examples: Winter weather brought sub-zero (= less than 0 degrees) temperatures to much of the country.
